notesStmt.note: Imperfect at the end. Leaves missing after folio 332.

1 older paper flyleaf at the beginning of the manuscript with birth notes, 16th century (folio 1r). Inscription in an initial-word panel: 'Yishmael, Nehemiah, Raphael, Hayim Ottolenghi, Judah Eliezer, Nahman, brothers, sons of Menahem' (folio 110v). Birth notes, 16th century (folio 1r). Italian inscription: belonged to the Foa Library in Reggio ([iv verso], inside front cover).
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

collation.p: 33 quires: i10 (folios 1-10), ii10 (folios 11-20), iii10 (folios 21-30), iv10 (folios 31-40), v10 (folios 41-50), vi10 (folios 51-60), vii10 (folios 61-70), viii10 (folios 71-80), ix10 (folios 81-90), x10 (folios 91-100), xi10 (folios 101-110), xii10 (folios 111-120), xiii10 (folios 121-130), xiv10 (folios 131-140), xv10 (folios 141-150), xvi10 (folios151-160), xvii10 (folios 161-170), xviii10 (folios 171-180), xix10 (folios 181-190), xx10 (folios 191-200), xxi10 (folios 201-210), xxii10 (folios 211-220), xxiii10 (folios 221-230), xxiv10 (folios 231-240), xxv10 (folios 241-250), xxvi10 (folios 251-260), xxvii10 (folios 261-270), xxviii10 (folios 271-280), xxix10 (folios 281-290), xxx10 (folios 291-300), xxxi12 (folios 301-312), xxxii10 (folios 313-322), xxxiii10+1 (folios 323-333). Catchwords on the last page of the quire, in middle of lower margin.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Ashkenazi square script (punctuated), Italian semi-cursive script (unpunctuated) of the 14th to 15th century. Meshulam: written in red in the text, folio 166r.

decoDesc.decoNote: 2r 2 decorated initial-word panels in architectural structure, in colours and gold.

binding.p: BM in-house. Spine: 'Former & Latter Prophets. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Additional Ms. 11657.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Thomas Rodd the younger (b. 1796, d. 1849): purchased from him by the British Museum on 21 September 1839 : inscribed, [334v]).
